New Records: Corbin Carroll is the first player in MLB history with three or more hits and two or more stolen bases in a Game 7.
Key Match Events: The Diamondbacks won the National League pennant by defeating the Philadelphia Phillies.
Brandon Pfaadt had a strong performance with seven strikeouts in four innings.
Key hits from Gabriel Moreno, Corbin Carroll, and Ketel Marte contributed to the win.
Kevin Ginkel struck out three consecutive batters in the eighth inning.
Paul Sewald retired the side in order in the ninth inning to secure the victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Torey Lovullo emphasized the team's desire to prove doubters wrong.
Chris 'Mad Dog' Russo publicly stated he would retire if the Diamondbacks won Games 6 and 7 in Philadelphia.
Post-Match Reflections: Corbin Carroll expressed his excitement about going to the World Series.
Evan Longoria reflected on the team's journey and overcoming doubts.
Tommy Pham urged not to count the team out in the World Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks' scoring began in the first inning, which helped quiet the crowd at Citizens Bank Park.
The Diamondbacks are the first team to go from 110 or more losses to a World Series berth in two years.
